---
title: "Part 2: Shell Commands Exercise"
format: html
---

## Download the data

```{bash}
#| echo: true
curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stephaniehicks/jhustatprogramming2025/main/projects/01-project/students.csv
```

## Display file contents

```{bash}
#| echo: true
cat students.csv
```

## Show first 5 lines

```{bash}
#| echo: true
head -5 students.csv
```

## Show last 3 lines

```{bash}
#| echo: true
tail -3 students.csv
```

## Count lines

```{bash}
#| echo: true
wc -l students.csv
```

## Find Math students

```{bash}
#| echo: true
grep "Math" students.csv
```

## Find female students

```{bash}
#| echo: true
grep ",F," students.csv
```

## Sort by age

```{bash}
#| echo: true
(head -1 students.csv && tail -n +2 students.csv | sort -t',' -k3 -n)
```

## Find unique subjects

```{bash}
#| echo: true
tail -n +2 students.csv | cut -d',' -f6 | sort | uniq
```

## Calculate average grade

```{bash}
#| echo: true
awk -F',' 'NR>1 {sum+=\$5; count++} END {print "Average Grade:", sum/count}' students.csv
```

## Replace Math with Mathematics

```{bash}
#| echo: true
sed 's/Math/Mathematics/g' students.csv
```

## Run all commands together

```{bash}
#| echo: true
./student_analysis.sh
```
